nodes.bodyText:
I don't think this is a rolling upgrade breaker. This data does not go over the wire.
Also, we could keep existing format and just write null/empty values for detached nodes, to minimize changes.
This id is already present in the base class
This likely breaks rolling upgrades compatibility, and I'm not sure if we need to override at all.

Unfortunately, the whole change is breaking RU and the C++ platform.
I think this is kind of expected if you are dealing with cache configuration changes?

It is fine to say that "if you use this new feature, RU will break". But here we break RU for Service Node Filters, because we change the format.
And this format change looks unnecessary to me, we can remove those overrides.
Can we call ctx.createClusterNodeFilter instead?
We should throw a descriptive exception instead. Using .NET node filter in mixed cluster is not supported. Silently ignoring this will lead to unexpected behavior.
This should be in Apache.Ignite.Core.Cluster namespace / folder.

+
+namespace Apache.Ignite.Core.Cluster
+{
+    using System;
+    using System.Collections.Generic;
+    using System.Diagnostics;
+    using Apache.Ignite.Core.Binary;
+    using Apache.Ignite.Core.Impl.Common;
+
+    /// <summary>
+    /// Attribute node filter.
+    ///
+    /// The filter will evaluate to true if a node has provided attribute set to
+    /// corresponding values.
+    ///
+    /// You can set user attribute using <see cref="IgniteConfiguration.UserAttributes"/> property. 
+    /// </summary>
+    public sealed class AttributeNodeFilter : IClusterNodeFilter
+    {
+        /// <summary>
+        /// Attributes dictionary match.
+        /// </summary>
+        public IDictionary<string, object> Attributes { get; set; }
+
+        /// <summary>
+        /// Initializes a new instance of <see cref="AttributeNodeFilter"/>.
+        /// </summary>
+        public AttributeNodeFilter()
+        {
+        }
+
+        /// <summary>
+        /// Initializes a new instance of <see cref="AttributeNodeFilter"/>.
+        /// </summary>
+        /// <param name="attrName">Attribute name.</param>
+        /// <param name="attrValue">Attribute value.</param>
+        public AttributeNodeFilter(string attrName, object attrValue)
+        {
+            IgniteArgumentCheck.NotNullOrEmpty(attrName, "attrName");
+
+            Attributes = new Dictionary<string, object>(1)
+            {
+                {attrName, attrValue}
+            };
+        }
+

Please add a test for this case
The filter will evaluate to true if a node has all specified attributes with corresponding values
